document.masterDocTitle: A review of the genus Cryptopleurum from China (Coleoptera: Hydrophilidae)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Cryptopleurum pygmaeum d’Orchymont, 1913: 15
.
Cryptopleurum pygmaeum : HANSEN (1999: 309)
: catalogue.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material examined.
PARATYPE : 1 spec. ( ISNB ): ‘ Taihorin / Formosa / H. Sauter , 23.90ºN 121.08ºE , VII, 1911 // Coll. A. d’Orchymont // Cryptopleurum / pygmaeum / Co-type d’Orch // Para- / type
.’;
1 spec. ( ISNB ): ‘ Taihorin / Formosa / H. Sauter , 23.90ºN 121.08ºE ,
VII.1991
// Coll.A. d’Orchymont // Para- / type’
.

Differential diagnosis. This species can be easily distinguished from the other known species except
C. ferrugineum
by its smaller size and the metaventrite with a curved elevated line enclosing the mesocoxal cavity, being sharply defined mesally, and laterally connected to the femoral lines near anterolateral angle. It can be separated from
C. ferrugineum
by its smaller size, elytra with the seventh and eighth striae being very close in the same groove, and interval eight being distinctly narrower than the neighboring intervals.
Distribution. So far only known from China ( Taiwan) and Vietnam .

A key to the Chinese species of
Cryptopleurum
(modified from d’ORCHYMONT 1926)

‒ Elytra with the seventh and eighth striae very close in the same groove, interval eight distinctly narrower than neighboring intervals ( Figs 5 , 12 , 20 , 29 , 42 ). Metaventrite with or without fine elevated line enclosing mesocoxal cavity. ........................................... 2

paragraph.keyLead:
2 Size 1.3–1.5 mm . Metaventrite with a curved fine elevated line totally enclosing mesocoxal cavity and laterally connected to the femoral line ( Fig. 45 ). ................................. ...................................................................................
C. pygmaeum d’Orchymont, 1913

‒ Size 1.6–2.2 mm . Metaventrite with anterolateral portion bearing different microsculpture, not delimited by a line at all, or at most slightly delimited by a short elevated line laterally ( Figs 6 , 15 , 22 , 30 ). ......................................................................................... 3

3 Pronotum with double punctation, shagreened between punctures ( Figs 23 , 31 ). Elytral striae strongly impressed from base to apex, elytral intervals 2‒5 and 7‒9 highly convex or costiform, punctures on intervals fine, at most as coarse as the smaller ones on pronotum. ................................................................................................................................ 4

‒ Pronotum with punctures of the same size only ( Figs 4 , 16 , 46 ), interstices smooth or with short longitudinal microsculpture. Elytral striae weakly impressed in basal half, somewhat impressed apically, intervals simple or moderately convex apically ( Figs 1, 3 , 9, 11 ), punctures on intervals almost as coarse as those on pronotum. ......................... 5
